question_label: Which one of the following is included in Bacterial Priority pathogen list of WHO in 2024 in critical priority pathogen list:

options.option_label: Pseudomonas aeruginosa carbapenem-resistant
Staphylococcus aureus methicillin-resistant
Acinetobacter baumannii carbapenem-resistant
Enterobacterales third-generation cephalosporin-resistant
Salmonella Typhi fluoroquinolone-resistant

question_label: According to The Review on Antimicrobial Resistance Chaired By Jim O’neill in May 2016 what was the prediction of death attributable to AMR by 2050:

options.option_label: 10 million
4.95 million
1·27 million
4·71 million
1·91 million

question_label: Identify the reserve group of antibiotics according to WHO Access, Watch, Reserve (AWaRe) classification:

options.option_label: Ceftriaxone
Vancomycin
Meropenem
Linezolid
Ceftazidime-avibactam

question_label: What is the primary objective of the Global Action Plan (GAP) on Antimicrobial Resistance (AMR) developed by the World Health Organization (WHO)?

options.option_label: To eliminate the use of antibiotics in agriculture.
To develop new antibiotics to replace all existing ones.
To ensure the prevention and control of infections in humans and animals.
To promote the use of traditional medicine over antibiotics.
To reduce the cost of antibiotics worldwide.

question_label: What is meant by 'selection pressure' in the context of antibiotic use?

options.option_label: The process by which bacteria develop resistance to antibiotics due to genetic mutations.
The increased effectiveness of antibiotics over time as bacteria become more susceptible.
The environmental factors that favor the survival of antibiotic-resistant bacteria over susceptible ones.
The reduction in the number of bacterial infections due to widespread antibiotic use.
The ability of antibiotics to kill all types of bacteria, including resistant strains.

question_label: What is the primary goal of the One Health Approach in combating antimicrobial resistance (AMR)?

options.option_label: To develop new antibiotics exclusively for human use.
To integrate efforts across human, animal, and environmental health sectors.
To eliminate the use of antibiotics in agriculture.
To focus solely on reducing antibiotic use in hospitals.
To promote the use of traditional medicine over antibiotics.

question_label: What is considered the main cause of antibiotic resistance?

options.option_label: Overuse and misuse of antibiotics in human medicine.
Natural evolution of bacteria.
Lack of new antibiotic development.
Poor hygiene and sanitation practices.
Global travel and trade.

question_label: Why is AMR surveillance crucial in the containment of antimicrobial resistance?

options.option_label: It helps in the development of new antibiotics.
It monitors the effectiveness of current treatment protocols.
It identifies trends and patterns in antibiotic resistance.
It reduces the cost of healthcare.
It eliminates the need for antibiotics in agriculture.

question_label: How do vaccines contribute to the containment of antimicrobial resistance (AMR)?

options.option_label: By directly killing antibiotic-resistant bacteria.
By reducing the incidence of infections, thereby decreasing the need for antibiotics.
By increasing the effectiveness of existing antibiotics.
By promoting the development of new antibiotics.
By eliminating the need for hygiene and sanitation practices.

question_label: What is the primary goal of antimicrobial stewardship programs?

options.option_label: To eliminate the use of antibiotics in agriculture.
To ensure the appropriate use of antibiotics to improve patient outcomes and reduce resistance.
To develop new antibiotics to replace existing ones.
To promote the use of over-the-counter antibiotics.
To reduce the cost of antibiotics worldwide.

question_label: Regarding antibiogram which of the following statement/s is/are correct?

options.option_label: It is one of the main duties of a microbiology laboratory to prepare antibiogram.
Help to identify the most effective antibiotics for treating specific bacterial infections.
It should be prepared quarterly a year.
It reduces the cost of antibiotic treatments.
It promotes the use of over-the-counter antibiotics.

question_label: What is referred to as the 'Golden Age of Antibiotics'?

options.option_label: The period when antibiotics were first discovered and widely used, leading to significant reductions in infectious diseases.
The era when antibiotics were used exclusively in agriculture.
The time when antibiotics were replaced by vaccines.
The period when antibiotic resistance was first identified.
The era when antibiotics were banned due to side effects.

question_label: Which organizations are the National Coordination Center and Sectoral Coordination Center (Human health) for AMR surveillance in Bangladesh?

options.option_label: IEDCR and CDC, DGHS
BSMMU and IEDCR
DMCH and BSMMU
NIPSOM and CDC, DGHS
CDC, DGHS and IEDCR

question_label: What is the primary concern associated with Extended-Spectrum Beta-Lactamase (ESBL) producing bacteria?

options.option_label: They are resistant to all antibiotics.
They can produce toxins that cause severe illness.
They are resistant to a wide range of beta-lactam antibiotics, including third-generation cephalosporins.
They can only infect immunocompromised individuals.
They are easily treated with standard antibiotics.

question_label: What is the primary concern associated with Methicillin-Resistant Staphylococcus Aureus (MRSA)?

options.option_label: It is resistant to all antibiotics.
It can produce toxins that cause severe illness.
It is resistant to methicillin and other beta-lactam antibiotics, making infections difficult to treat.
It can only infect immunocompromised individuals.
It is easily treated with standard antibiotics.
